results.title: Energy management for the future
results.creator_credit: Michael Melnyk, Patrick Loubert, Melvana Communications Group and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Our society is rapidly depleting its energy bank. This film creates awareness of the seriousness of the situation, what measures the federal government has taken, and how each one of us can help slow down the rapid consumption of non-renewable resources.

results.title: Enemy alien
results.creator_credit: Jeanette Lerman, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This is about a people who dared to ask: “What are they going to do with us?” The Japanese-Canadians fought long and hard to be accepted as Canadians. It is important that the long story of frustration and injustice, mistrust and hate, and eventual triumph should be remembered. This film tells that story. (Awards: New York; Birmingham.)

results.title: Endoscopic Vanitas (No Veins Version)
results.credit_line:
Shaun Gladwell
plastic skull, endoscopic cameras, mechanised mount, transformer, fog machine and projection
ACMI Collection
results.material_description: Multi-channel installation, plastic skull, endoscopic cameras, mechanised mount, transformer, fog machine and projection
results.brief_description:
“Endoscopic Vanitas (No Veins Version)” is a reworking of a past work, originally exhibited in 2009 at the Venice Biennale, commissioned for the exhibition “Shaun Gladwell: Stereo Sequences” in 2011.

In the centre of the room a single human skull hangs suspended by a metal frame. An endoscopic camera moves inside the skull, a second explores its exterior. The images captured by the two cameras are projected onto separate screens, the first a mist screen that sits at the entrance to the room creating a permeable barrier to the cavernous space behind, the second a simple LCD screen inside the room. These images appear abstract, suggestive, lunar. Gladwell is playing with the time-honoured trope of the momento mori, as well as with Plato’s ‘allegory of the cave’.

results.title: End of the old order: 1900-1918
results.creator_credit: Jeremy Murray-Brown, Pat Ferns, Sam Summerlin, New York Times Productions and Nielsen-Ferns International
results.brief_description: This film begins with Queen Victoria’s funeral procession in 1901, at which time no one could envisage any threat of war. This film looks at the technological development of Germany, the mass migration to America during the first decade of this century, the seeking of allies by France, the events leading up to World War 1, and the Russian Revolution

results.title: End game in Paris
results.creator_credit: Veronika Soul, Robert Verrall and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An adaptation of a segment of Ian Adam’s novel ‘End Game in Paris’, this film concerns a man’s search for his double. The man, a freelance photographer recently returned from Saigon, discovers that his life is being threatened. Filmmaker Veronika Soul experiments with sound and image to create a tense, enigmatic drama in which the audience is walked along a thin edge. Camera by Wolf Koenig. (Awards: Yorkton)

results.title: Empty Quarter
results.brief_description:
Set in Djibouti, this story is filmed in subjective camera style. An introspective, slightly self-absorbed journalist asks a French woman to share a room with him. He is attracted to her but is not sure how to go about making that point clear. They spend their time in banal conversation. After seeing an Australian movie (‘The man from Snowy River’) they decide to make their way across the desert to Alexandria.

Credits: Producers, Pascale Dauman, Francois Margolin ; director, Raymond Depardon ; writer, Raymond Depardon ; photography, Raymond Depardon.
Cast: Francoise Prenant.

results.title: Empty harbours, empty dreams
results.creator_credit: Kent Martin, Barry Cowling, Rex Tasker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The film explores how the three British colonies of New Brunswick, Nova Scotia and Prince Edward Island became provinces of Canada, and it charts the subsequent decline of their economies after Confederation. Photographs, archival drawings, cartoons, and interviews with Maritime historians are used to document the case. An important contribution to the continuing dialogue on the history and evolution of Canada’s federal system.

results.title: Empty arms, broken hearts
results.creator_credit: Iain E. Gillespie, Jacqueline Gillespie, AFFC and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description: A film by publicised parents of kidnapped children, Jacqueline and Iain Gillespie, this documentary attempts to enlighten it’s viewer of the torment and distress involved in losing a child to kidnapping by a parent. It also raises the problems associated with bringing into place international treaties designed to allow a country authority to pursue the kidnapping parent and return the child to his/her other parent at home.

results.title: Empire of the sun [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Steven Spielberg, Frank Marshall, Kathleen Kennedy, Amblin Entertainment and Robert Shapiro
results.brief_description: Jim Graham, a young Briton living a comfortable life in Shanghai, is separated from his parents following the Japanese invasion of China at the start of World War II. The separation leads to Jim being caught in an internment camp where he has to fend for himself. Cast includes John Malkovich, Christian Bale, Miranda Richardson and Nigel Havers. Based on the autobiographical novel by J. G. Ballard.
